suggested_topics: why some bridges last 2000 years and others collapse in 20
how coral reefs build their own weather systems
the logistics of running a 24-hour diner
why birds migrate in V formations — physics not instinct
the hidden math behind musical scales

formats.name: micro_manifesto
formats.instruction: Declare a radically concise belief or mission (max one sentence). Then, in a single follow-up sentence, explain why it matters. Each sentence should contrast or surprise.

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Write out a piece of advice you regret following. Then describe what you wish you had done instead, focusing on lessons learned. Tell your story in two sharply different sections.

formats.name: pattern_spotter
formats.instruction: Identify an unexpected pattern or coincidence you've noticed in life, culture, or tech. Present your observation in one paragraph, then speculate wildly about its meaning.

formats.name: snapshot_dialogue
formats.instruction: Sum up a real or imagined conversation in dialogue format (at least three lines). Each character must represent a different viewpoint or emotion. End with a punchy takeaway line.

formats.name: spoiler_alert
formats.instruction: Reveal a twist you experienced in learning, work, or daily life—without context. Structure as 'Here’s what I expected..., Here’s what actually happened.'

formats.name: hypothesis_upgrade
formats.instruction: State a commonly held belief about a topic, then build upon it with your own hypothesis, and justify it with at least one surprise example.

formats.name: timeline_rollercoaster
formats.instruction: Describe a personal or public event as a timeline with 5 key moments. Each moment should be a micro-drama (one sentence). End with a final lesson or prediction.

formats.name: eco_echo
formats.instruction: Reflect on your interaction with nature or environment in a single paragraph. Use vivid sensory language and end with a quick actionable tip.

formats.name: invisible_rules
formats.instruction: Expose an unspoken rule or social script that governs some aspect of life. Briefly state the rule, then give an example of how it shaped your choices.

title_styles: Write a curious question that teases the topic: 'Why does nobody talk about X?' or 'What happens if you try Y?'
Write a poetic, metaphorical title: 'When deadlines become dominoes', 'The echo of old advice'
Write a title that promises surprise: 'You won’t believe what I learned from X', 'The twist nobody saw coming'
Write a list-style title: '3 patterns in Z you never noticed', '5 moments that shaped my view of Y'
Write an abstract, philosophical title: 'Invisible boundaries and how we cross them', 'What’s the real cost of convenience?'
structure_variants: Write in alternating short paragraphs: first, story; second, analysis; third, call-to-action.
Start with a quote (real or made up), then unpack its relevance in three bullet points.
Use a timeline format with labels for each stage (e.g., 'Expectation', 'Reality', 'Lesson').
Write as a mini-script or dialogue with named speakers, ending on a summary line.
Begin with a vivid sensory detail, then zoom out with broader context in the next section.
topic_angles: How technology is subtly changing the way we communicate
Hidden rituals of everyday life (commutes, shopping, eating)
Unspoken expectations in education or workplaces
Moments when nature surprised you or altered your plans
